So I wasn't being quite patient enough. I can see the problem by watching gztopic echo /gazebo/default/world_stats in a separate window and interacting with gzclient.

I start a world unpaused, and it runs fine. I can reset the world, the model poses, and time successfully.

The problem arises when I send a pause message. Pressing the pause button causes at least a 5 second delay for me in between world_stats messages. Here are three adjacent messages in order:

sim_time { sec: 5 nsec: 274000000 } pause_time { sec: 0 nsec: 0 } real_time { sec: 5 nsec: 288326742 } paused: false

sim_time { sec: 9 nsec: 74000000 } pause_time { sec: 0 nsec: 0 } real_time { sec: 9 nsec: 98440524 } paused: false

sim_time { sec: 9 nsec: 216000000 } pause_time { sec: 0 nsec: 59000000 } real_time { sec: 9 nsec: 240263301 } paused: true

In this case, there was a 4 second gap between pressing pause and seeing a response in world_stats. The amount of time delay is variable. I just ran it again, and there was a 13 second delay.

John, can you duplicate this delay on your machine?
